docs.text: Welcome to the MilkCrate CNC Project! This site contains all the info and instructions you'll need to build your own desktop CNC mill! If you're new to the project, check out the About page to learn the backstory of the MilkCrate CNC. If you have some questions about it, check out our FAQ page! Your question is most likely answered there. Development and discussion of the project is done in the Makers On Tap Podcast Discord server.
docs.title: Home

docs.title: Welcome to the MilkCrate CNC Project!

docs.text: Bill of Materials Current BOM can be found in this read only Google Sheet . The BOM is considered stable and safe to order from. Printed Parts List All the non-jig printed parts are print 1 of each, unless otherwise noted in the filename (i.e. Hinge_6x.stl is 6 units) You'll need two of each jig

docs.text: Frequently Asked Questions Can it cut aluminum? Yes. We should probably embed some youtube videos here as proof.
docs.title: FAQ

docs.text: Yes. We should probably embed some youtube videos here as proof.
docs.title: Can it cut aluminum?

docs.text: Print Settings Filament Parts can be printed in any of these materials: Standard PETG PLA-Pro Perimeter perimeters: 4 perimeter width: 0.56mm Infill infill: 40% infill type: triangle infill width: 0.6mm Layers layer height: 0.25mm
docs.title: Print Settings

docs.text: Parts can be printed in any of these materials: Standard PETG PLA-Pro

docs.text: infill: 40% infill type: triangle infill width: 0.6mm
